revised_title: Anatomy and Function of the Uterine Nerves and Related Ganglia
tldr: The author examines the nerves of the uterus and related ganglia to understand their structure and function. They found that the nerves did not change in size during pregnancy and discovered the arrangement of the nervous fibers in the splanchnic nerve. The study also discusses the renal plexus, supra renal capsule nerves, and inferior aortic plexus, providing insights into the autonomic nervous system and human anatomy.
